carousel_items: Drink plenty of fluids while taking Mucinex D because liquid helps break down mucus.
Follow age-specific dosing instructions on how much to take. Don't take more than the recommended dose.
You need to show an ID to buy Mucinex D in the drugstore because it contains pseudoephedrine.
Don't take Mucinex D too close to bedtime since it can keep you awake.
Can cause an irregular or fast heartbeat, and can raise your blood pressure.

basics.benefits_moa: Mucinex D is a combination medicine. Guaifenesin (an expectorant) breaks up and thins out mucus. Pseudoephedrine (a decongestant) clears your sinuses.
basics.bottom_line: Mucinex D is good if you have a stuffy nose and a cough with mucus, but it could keep you up at night.
downsides: Pseudoephedrine, the decongestant in Mucinex D, can make your heart race or make you feel anxious and restless.
Doesn't work as well if you use it for more than 4 days at a time.
Although you don't need a prescription to get Mucinex D, you need to show a photo ID to buy it in the drugstore.
Mucinex D isn’t useful if you have a dry cough.

downsides_processed.orig: Pseudoephedrine, the decongestant in Mucinex D, can make your heart race or make you feel anxious and restless.
Doesn't work as well if you use it for more than 4 days at a time.
Although you don't need a prescription to get Mucinex D, you need to show a photo ID to buy it in the drugstore.
Mucinex D isn’t useful if you have a dry cough.

upsides: Mucinex D is a combination medicine that relieves multiple cold symptoms. It's good to use if you have sinus and chest congestion.
Helps loosen the mucus in your airways so that you can cough it up more easily.
Works well to clear nasal congestion and help you breathe better.

upsides_processed.orig: Mucinex D is a combination medicine that relieves multiple cold symptoms. It's good to use if you have sinus and chest congestion.
Helps loosen the mucus in your airways so that you can cough it up more easily.
Works well to clear nasal congestion and help you breathe better.

drugs.one_liner: Breaks up mucus and relieves congestion.
drugs.name: Mucinex D

carousel_items_processed.orig: Drink plenty of fluids while taking Mucinex D because liquid helps break down mucus.
Follow age-specific dosing instructions on how much to take. Don't take more than the recommended dose.
You need to show an ID to buy Mucinex D in the drugstore because it contains pseudoephedrine.
Don't take Mucinex D too close to bedtime since it can keep you awake.
Can cause an irregular or fast heartbeat, and can raise your blood pressure.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: People taking Mucinex D and MAO inhibitors together, or up to 14 days apart from each other, can experience very high blood pressure that can cause headaches and strokes. MAOI drugs are used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking MAO inhibitors and still want to use a cough medicine.

description_processed.orig: People taking Mucinex D and MAO inhibitors together, or up to 14 days apart from each other, can experience very high blood pressure that can cause headaches and strokes. MAOI drugs are used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking MAO inhibitors and still want to use a cough medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Pseudoephedrine can put additional stress on your heart. | Be careful when using it if you have a history of heart problems. Talk to your doctor if another option might be better for you.

description_processed.orig: Pseudoephedrine can put additional stress on your heart. | Be careful when using it if you have a history of heart problems. Talk to your doctor if another option might be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Nausea and vomiting
risks_warnings.description: People taking Mucinex D have reported nausea and vomiting. This is very rare and usually not serious. If you develop a fever with the nausea and vomiting, then talk to your doctor right away.

description_processed.orig: People taking Mucinex D have reported nausea and vomiting. This is very rare and usually not serious. If you develop a fever with the nausea and vomiting, then talk to your doctor right away.

carousel_items: Cough suppressant starts working in 15 to 30 minutes.
Follow age-specific dosing instructions on how much to take. Don't take more than the recommended dose.
Drink plenty of fluids while taking Mucinex DM because liquid helps break down mucus.
If your cough lasts more than 7 days, call your doctor.

basics.benefits_moa: Mucinex DM is a combination medicine. Guaifenesin is an expectorant that breaks up and thins out mucus. Dextromethorphan is a cough suppressant.
basics.bottom_line: Mucinex DM is okay for loosening congestion in your chest and throat, but it could prevent you from coughing the mucus up. It comes as an extended-release tablet and a short-acting liquid.
downsides: Mucinex DM isn’t useful if you have a dry cough without mucus or phlegm.
The two medications in this product could potentially work against each other. Guaifenesin makes mucus easier to cough up, while dextromethorphan (the "DM" in Mucinex DM) stops you from coughing.
Can cause sleepiness, dizziness, and an upset stomach.

downsides_processed.orig: Mucinex DM isn’t useful if you have a dry cough without mucus or phlegm.
The two medications in this product could potentially work against each other. Guaifenesin makes mucus easier to cough up, while dextromethorphan (the "DM" in Mucinex DM) stops you from coughing.
Can cause sleepiness, dizziness, and an upset stomach.

upsides: Mucinex DM is a combination medicine that relieves multiple cold symptoms. It's good to use if you have chest congestion and a cough.
Helps loosen the mucus and phlegm that builds up in productive and wet coughs.
The extended release version of Mucinex DM lasts up to 12 hours.

upsides_processed.orig: Mucinex DM is a combination medicine that relieves multiple cold symptoms. It's good to use if you have chest congestion and a cough.
Helps loosen the mucus and phlegm that builds up in productive and wet coughs.
The extended release version of Mucinex DM lasts up to 12 hours.

drugs.one_liner: Breaks up mucus and relieves cough.

userStories.tip: Last winter I had this problem where when I would lay down to sleep I would start coughing. I took this and 20 minutes later I laid down - no coughing. After a week or so the problem went away. Came back again later and this helped again.

I always use this and nasal irrigation to break up mucus. Extremely effective. Best to avoid taking before you are about to do any strenuous or highly social activity - or at least have a lot of tissues on hand.

drugs.name: Mucinex DM

carousel_items_processed.orig: Cough suppressant starts working in 15 to 30 minutes.
Follow age-specific dosing instructions on how much to take. Don't take more than the recommended dose.
Drink plenty of fluids while taking Mucinex DM because liquid helps break down mucus.
If your cough lasts more than 7 days, call your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Nausea and vomiting
risks_warnings.description: People taking Mucinex DM have reported nausea and vomiting. This is very rare and usually not serious. If you develop a fever with the nausea and vomiting, then talk to your doctor right away.

description_processed.orig: People taking Mucinex DM have reported nausea and vomiting. This is very rare and usually not serious. If you develop a fever with the nausea and vomiting, then talk to your doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition when there's too much serotonin in the brain. The dextromethorphan in Mucinex DM, when used with other medicines that affect serotonin (antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort), increases your risk for serotonin syndrome. Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have these symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

description_processed.orig: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition when there's too much serotonin in the brain. The dextromethorphan in Mucinex DM, when used with other medicines that affect serotonin (antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort), increases your risk for serotonin syndrome. Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have these symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Cough warning
risks_warnings.description: Stop using Mucinex DM and talk to a doctor if your cough lasts more than 7 days, has too much mucus, comes back, or if you begin to have a fever, rash, or continuous headache. These signs could mean you have a more serious infection or problem.

description_processed.orig: Stop using Mucinex DM and talk to a doctor if your cough lasts more than 7 days, has too much mucus, comes back, or if you begin to have a fever, rash, or continuous headache. These signs could mean you have a more serious infection or problem.

carousel_items: Drink plenty of fluids while taking Mucinex because liquid helps break down mucus.
Steam from a humidifier, cool mist vaporizer, or hot shower can also help add moisture to your airways.
Follow age-specific dosing instructions on how much to take.
If your cough lasts more than 7 days, call your doctor.
Mucinex only works for coughs with mucus, so don't use it if you have a dry cough.

basics.benefits_moa: Mucinex is an expectorant. It contains guaifenesin, which thins and loosens mucus, making it easier to cough out.
basics.bottom_line: Mucinex is a useful medicine for loosening congestion in your chest and throat, and it lasts longer than other guaifenesin products.
downsides: Mucinex is more expensive than other medications that treat congestion.
You need to drink a lot of fluids while taking this medication or it won't work as well.
Mucinex isn’t useful if you have a dry cough.
Can cause nausea, headache, and an upset stomach.

downsides_processed.orig: Mucinex is more expensive than other medications that treat congestion.
You need to drink a lot of fluids while taking this medication or it won't work as well.
Mucinex isn’t useful if you have a dry cough.
Can cause nausea, headache, and an upset stomach.

upsides: Mucinex reduces the thickness and amount of mucus in your throat and chest.
Lasts longer than some other products that contain guaifenesin, such as Robitussin, because it's an extended-release form.
It’s available at the drugstore either by itself or in combination with other medications to treat cold and flu symptoms.
Available in liquid and tablet forms.
Mucinex is alcohol- and sugar-free.

upsides_processed.orig: Mucinex reduces the thickness and amount of mucus in your throat and chest.
Lasts longer than some other products that contain guaifenesin, such as Robitussin, because it's an extended-release form.
It’s available at the drugstore either by itself or in combination with other medications to treat cold and flu symptoms.
Available in liquid and tablet forms.
Mucinex is alcohol- and sugar-free.

Follow age-specific dosing instructions on how much to take.
If your cough lasts more than 7 days, call your doctor.
Mucinex only works for coughs with mucus, so don't use it if you have a dry cough.

risks_warnings.title: Nausea and vomiting
risks_warnings.description: Some people taking Mucinex have reported nausea and vomiting. This is very rare and usually not serious. However, if you develop a fever with the nausea and vomiting, then talk to your doctor right away.

description_processed.orig: Some people taking Mucinex have reported nausea and vomiting. This is very rare and usually not serious. However, if you develop a fever with the nausea and vomiting, then talk to your doctor right away.

carousel_items: Drink plenty of fluids while taking Mucus Relief PE because liquid helps break down mucus.
Phenylephrine, the decongestant, can make you restless, so don't take it too close to bedtime.
Follow age-specific dosing instructions on how much to take. Don't take more than the recommended dose.
Let your doctor know if your symptoms don't improve in a few days, or if you have a really bad sore throat with a fever, headache, nausea, or vomiting.

basics.benefits_moa: Mucus Relief PE is a combination medicine that treats cold and congestion symptoms. Guaifenesin breaks up mucus and phlegm. Phenylephrine is a decongestant that clears your sinuses.
basics.bottom_line: Mucus Relief PE is good for treating cold and congestion symptoms, but it won't relieve coughing.
downsides: Mucus Relief PE doesn't stop coughing.
Phenylephrine doesn't last as long as other oral decongestants like pseudoephedrine.
You shouldn't use it if you have high blood pressure.

downsides_processed.orig: Mucus Relief PE doesn't stop coughing.
Phenylephrine doesn't last as long as other oral decongestants like pseudoephedrine.
You shouldn't use it if you have high blood pressure.

upsides: Mucus Relief PE is a combination medicine that relieves multiple cold and congestion symptoms. It's good to use if you have a stuffy nose and congestion.
Helps loosen the mucus and phlegm that builds up in productive and wet coughs.

The decongestant (phenylephrine) has fewer side effects than other decongestants like pseudoephedrine. It doesn't raise your blood pressure and heart rate as much, or cause as much trouble falling asleep.

upsides_processed.orig: Mucus Relief PE is a combination medicine that relieves multiple cold and congestion symptoms. It's good to use if you have a stuffy nose and congestion.
Helps loosen the mucus and phlegm that builds up in productive and wet coughs.

The decongestant (phenylephrine) has fewer side effects than other decongestants like pseudoephedrine. It doesn't raise your blood pressure and heart rate as much, or cause as much trouble falling asleep.

description_processed.orig: Stop using Mucus Relief PE and talk to a doctor if your cough lasts more than 7 days, has too much mucus, comes back, or if you begin to have a fever, rash, or continuous headache. These signs could mean you have a more serious infection or problem.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to unborn babies
risks_warnings.description: Mucus Relief PE can harm unborn babies. Phenylephrine can be unsafe to take during the first 3 months of pregnancy (first trimester). Instead, it's safer to use a decongestant nasal spray for up to 3 days. Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.

description_processed.orig: Mucus Relief PE can harm unborn babies. Phenylephrine can be unsafe to take during the first 3 months of pregnancy (first trimester). Instead, it's safer to use a decongestant nasal spray for up to 3 days. Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.

basics.benefits_moa: Robitussin DM is a combination medicine. Guaifenesin is an expectorant that breaks up and thins out mucus. Dextromethorphan is a cough suppressant.
basics.bottom_line: Robitussin DM is okay for loosening congestion in your chest and throat, but it could prevent you from coughing the mucus up. You have to take it more often than other guaifenesin products.
downsides: Robitussin DM isn’t useful if you have a dry cough without mucus or phlegm.
The two medications in this product could potentially work against each other. Guaifenesin makes mucus easier to cough up, while dextromethorphan (the "DM" in Robitussin DM) stops you from coughing.
Needs to be taken more often during the day than other products with guaifenesin, like Mucinex.
Can cause sleepiness, dizziness, and an upset stomach.

userStories.identifier: Retail with constant contact with people
userStories.tip: I wish I would've known that it has two ingredients that work against each other, which caused this product to not work for me. I needed something that helped me remove mucus and a cough supressant, but got neither with this product.
